Jason or Ken,

   I am attempting to understand the nature of inputs & outp=
uts as 
applied to both the Hypercube and substrate networks, without being=
 
limited to the geometric nature of the visual-based examples. The 
exampl=
es provided were helpful, but I am striving for a more general 
guideline f=
or application to more general problems.

   Would it be correct to say tha=
t:

(a) Substrate Network: Inputs & Outputs identified as typical to 
appli=
cation of conventional NEAT to a problem of interest;

(b) Hypercube Networ=
k: (i) Inputs: Other descriptors/parameters (i.e. 
geometric coordinates be=
ing a subset thereof), associated with a given 
substrate network node (i.e=
. like a timestamp associated with a 
coordinate point comprising a traject=
ory), mutually exclusive of the 
descriptor/parameter expressly identified =
in the substrate node, each 
being collected together and collectively iden=
tified as either a "from" 
or "to" terminator of a link between any two sub=
strate nodes; and (ii) 
Output: Weight of link between the currently identi=
fied "from" and "to" 
substrate nodes.

Thanks,
   Andy Carl
